definition: to strive for mastery (idiom); aiming for the best result/to have high ambitions
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: And Coca-Cola managed to make itself one of the most widely distributed products of wartime.
sentences.chinese: 可口可乐更力争上游，成为战时最畅销产品之一。

sentences.english: Zhu said, as he headed for an electronics factory, where he would inquire about profitability.
sentences.chinese: 朱先生曾经领导过一家电子厂，在利益率上力争上游。

sentences.english: To strive to be a pace-setter.
sentences.chinese: 一个好学生要有力争上游的决心。

sentences.english: We must improve in every area.
sentences.chinese: 我们应在各个领域力争上游。

sentences.english: I would then like to work up to a senior position, such as being a project team leader.
sentences.chinese: 之后我想要力争上游得到像专案经理这样的主管职位。

sentences.english: Each student strives for the best in this class.
sentences.chinese: 这个班级每个同学都力争上游。

sentences.english: New avenues of achievement require commitment to growth.
sentences.chinese: 决心力争上游才会有新的成就。

sentences.english: Some young men have no idea to be the top one in anything;
sentences.chinese: 一些年轻人从不力争上游，他们是可悲的。

sentences.english: Race to the Top had good goals, but poor implementation.
sentences.chinese: “力争上游”计划的目标很好，但是实施很糟。

definition: to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
(idiom) not want to be outdone/not content to lag behind
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to make progress/to do better/fig. ambitious to improve oneself/to move forwards
to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
